Interface::ISystemObject

Interface::ISystemObject Class Reference

ISystemObject is an interface class designed to be an extension of the UObject. Systems can extend the UObject by implementing this interface to give it new properties.

An example would be a physics system implementing this interface so that the UObject would now be able to interact with the physics system. More...

Detailed Description

ISystemObject is an interface class designed to be an extension of the UObject. Systems can extend the UObject by implementing this interface to give it new properties.

An example would be a physics system implementing this interface so that the UObject would now be able to interact with the physics system.

virtual System::Type Interface::ISystemObject::GetSystemType ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Gets the system type for this system object.

This is a shortcut to getting the system type w/o having to go the system first.

Returns:
The type of the system.

virtual System::Changes::BitMask Interface::ISystemObject::GetDesiredSystemChanges ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Returns a bit mask of System Changes that this system wants to receive changes for. Used to inform the change control manager if this system's object should be informed of the change.
